Immigration and Refugee Protection Act and Regulations
D
Fall 2025
Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada
Immigration, Réfugiés et Citoyenneté Canada
Canada
INSTRUMENT OF DESIGNATION AND DELEGATION

I, Lena Metlege Diab, Minister of Citizenship and Immigration, repeal the former Immigration Instrument of Delegation dated March 11, 2025 and, pursuant to section 6 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (the Act), hereby establish:

Persons whose position is set out in Column 4 of an item of the attached schedule (designated officers) to carry out the powers and duties set out in column 3 of that item for the purpose of the provision(s) of the Act and/or Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations (the Regulations) set out in column 2 of that item;

Persons designated as officers to carry out the powers and duties set out in column 3 of the item for the purpose of the provision(s) of the Act and/or Regulations set out in column 2 of that item include

an official of the Department of Citizenship and Immigration (CIC)1 or of the Canada Border Services Agency (CBSA) who is required to temporarily replace an officer whose position is set out in column 4 of that item or who is required by his supervisor to temporarily carry out the duties of that position;
a CIC official that has direct or indirect supervisory responsibility for an officer whose position is set out in column 4 of that item; and,
a CBSA officer that has direct or indirect supervisory responsibility for an officer whose position is set out in column 4 of that item;

A person whose position is set out in column 4 of an item of the attached schedule is authorized to do anything that may be done by me and that is described in column 3 of that item for the purpose of the provision(s) of the Act and/or Regulations set out in column 2 of that item;

Persons authorized to do anything that may be done by me and that is described in column 3 of an item for the purpose of the provision(s) of the Act and/or Regulations set out in column 2 of that item include

o a CIC or CBSA official who is required to temporarily replace a person whose position is set out in column 4 of that item or who is required by his supervisor to temporarily carry out the duties of that position;
o a CIC official that has direct or indirect supervisory responsibility for a person whose position is set out in column 4 of that item; and
o a CBSA officer that has direct or indirect supervisory responsibility for a person whose position is set out in column 4 of that item.
The following definitions apply throughout this document
a) CI Case Processing Officer, Immigration Operations Branch and Humanitarian and Identity Operations Branch and Settlement and Resettlement Operations (SRO) branch
A CIC officer occupying any of the following positions:

1 As the Instrument of Designation and Delegation (IDD) is a legal document, the legal title, Citizenship and Immigration Canada, is used to refer to the Department in this document. To align with the IDD, references to the Department in this document are also using the Department’s legal title.
i
CI Case Processing Officer
CI Officer, Inland
Integration Program Officer
CI Officer (Developmental)
CI Case Processing Officer, Resettlement Operations Centre – Ottawa (ROC-O), Resettlement Operations Division
Immigration/Integration Officer, Resettlement Services Assurance ,
Immigration Officer, Immigration Operations Branch -Rapid Response Operations Center (RROC)
b) Manager, Immigration Operations Branch and Humanitarian and Identity Operations Branch
A CIC officer at the PM-05 level or equivalent, occupying any of the following positions:
Manager
Operations Manager
Unit Manager
c) Migration Program Manager, International Platform Branch
An officer within the International Platform Branch of CIC occupying any of the following positions:
Migration Program Manager
Operations Manager
Deputy Migration Program Manager

Any Migration Program Manager, International Platform Branch, is understood as having the authority of International Platform Branch’s Unit Manager, Senior Immigration Officer and Immigration Officer, even if they do not have direct or indirect supervision of a person in one of those positions.

Any Area Director / Senior Director, International Platform Branch, is understood as having the authority of International Platform Branch's Migration Program Manager even if they do not have direct or indirect supervision of a person in one of those positions:
o Unit Manager
o Senior Immigration Officer
o Immigration Officer
d) Unit Manager, International Platform Branch
An officer within the International Platform Branch of CIC occupying any of the following positions:
Unit Manager
Risk Assessment Officer
Biometric VAC Officer

Any Unit Manager is also understood as having the authority of International Platform Branch’s Senior Immigration Officer and Immigration Officer, even if they do not have direct or indirect supervision of a person in one of those positions.
e) Area Director / Senior Director, International Platform Branch
ii
A Senior Director level position at the FS/EX 03 and FS/EX 02 level located in five geographic area across the world:
Americas and the Caribbean
Europe, Maghreb and Multilaterals
Middle East
Sub-Saharan Africa
Indo-Pacific

The Area Director / Senior Director ensures the integrity of the application of IRPA/R and other appropriate legislation through the effective management of regional resources in the geographic area of responsibility.
f) Senior Immigration Officer, International Platform Branch
A CIC Immigration Officer within the International Platform Branch occupying the position of a:
Senior Migration Officer or Senior Immigration Officer.

Any Senior Immigration Officer is also understood as having the authority of International Platform Branch’s Immigration Officer, even if they do not have direct or indirect supervision of an Immigration Officer.

Any CIC Foreign Service Officer, International Platform Branch at the FS-02 Level or higher also has the authority of a Senior Immigration Officer, International Platform Branch. This includes EX (FS).
g) Immigration Officer, International Platform Branch
A CIC Immigration Officer within the International Platform Branch occupying the position of a:
Migration Officer or Immigration Officer.
Any CIC Foreign Service Officer, International Platform Branch at the FS-01 level also has the authority of a Immigration Officer, International Platform Branch.
h) Designated Migration Officer, International Platform Branch
A locally-engaged staff member within the International Platform Branch occupying the position of a:
Designated Migration Officer

Any Designated Migration Officer is also understood as having the authority of International Platform Branch’s Designated Migration Officer TR, even if they do not have direct or indirect supervision of a Designated Migration Officer TR.
i) CBSA - Director, Enforcement and Intelligence
Includes an officer occupying any of the following positions:
Director, Intelligence and Enforcement
Director, Immigration Enforcement
Director, Intelligence and Criminal Investigations
j) CBSA - Assistant Director, Enforcement and Intelligence
iii
Includes an officer occupying any of the following positions:
Assistant Director, Intelligence and Enforcement
Assistant Director, Immigration Admissibility/Detention Hearings and Appeals
Assistant Director, Immigration Investigations
Assistant Director, Detentions and Operational Support
Assistant Director, Hearings
Assistant Director, Inland Enforcement
Assistant Director, Intelligence
Assistant Director, Refugee and Security Hearings and Appeals
Assistant Director, Removals
Assistant Director, Criminal Investigations Section
Assistant Director, Intelligence and Operational Support Unit
Assistant Director, Inland Enforcement and Data Integrity
Assistant Director, Investigations and Corporate Services
Assistant Director, Hearings and Guard Services

___________________________________________________________________ Signed the Honourable Lena Metlege Diab, P.C., M.P. Minister of Citizenship and Immigration Dated at _____________, this ______ of ________________, 2025 THIS INSTRUMENT TAKES EFFECT , 2025

text: 16. A15.1 ALL APPLICATIONS 17. R9.1(1) visa in order to visit their Canadian citizen or permanent resident child or grandchild for an extended period must have private health insurance– if the health insurance policy meets the following two conditions: (1) the foreign insurance company is authorized by the Office of the Superintendent of Financial Institutions (OSFI) under the Insurance Companies Act to provide accident and sickness insurance and appears on OSFI’s publicly available list of federally regulated financial institutions; and (2) the policy is issued or made during the course of its insurance business in Canada. A11, A15, A87.3, R75(3), R80(6), R203 A11, A15, R76(3), R87.2(4), MI Express Entry 5(2) Designation (in Canada) – Application for permanent residence visa (Federal Skilled Worker Class) Be satisfied whether the foreign national making an application for permanent resident visa under the Federal Skilled Worker Class meets or does not meet the requirements of the Ministerial Instructions made pursuant to A87.3; process the application for permanent resident visa; refuse the application for a visa; return, retain or otherwise dispose of the application; or send the application to the relevant Canadian mission overseas for further processing. Designation (in Canada) – Application for permanent resident visa (Federal Skilled Worker Class and Federal Skilled Trades Class) Refuse to substitute for 1) The criteria set out in 76(1)(a) of the Regulations a positive evaluation where the skilled worker has not been awarded the minimum number of required points referred to in the Regulations; return, retain or otherwise dispose of the application; or 2) The requirements set out in 87.2(3) of the Regulations a positive evaluation where the skilled trades worker has not met the requirements. Return, retain or otherwise dispose of the application; or send the application to the relevant Canadian mission overseas for further processing. Ability to meet requirements (2) The determination as to whether a foreign national meets the requirements of subsection (1) is made on the basis of the information provided in the expression of interest and an officer must not substitute their evaluation of whether or not the foreign national meets those requirements.
